comments:

2. Look into log file in .\metadata\.log

I have not seen this before. I noticed that some of the messages are in what looks like Czech so I'm guessing that you are using that locale, I'm not sure if that is related to the problem. Presumably you are not using a language pack, since the language pack for Eclipse 3.3 is not available yet.

What do you see when Eclipse starts? Do you see a Welcome screen at all?

(In reply to comment #1)
> I have not seen this before. I noticed that some of the messages are in what
> looks like Czech so I'm guessing that you are using that locale, I'm not sure
> if that is related to the problem. Presumably you are not using a language
> pack, since the language pack for Eclipse 3.3 is not available yet.
> 
> What do you see when Eclipse starts? Do you see a Welcome screen at all?
> 

Yes, you are right there is a czech error message, but it is not so important, because my java instalation used localized message texts.

What is important - I could see a Welcome screen, but the file C:\eclipse\intro\webresources\intro.xml doesn't exist on the filesystem, that's why I reported it. Why is created an error entry in log if welcome screen is showed?

Are you using the Eclipse SDK without any additional plugins? I'm not sure why it would be looking for intro\webresources\intro.xml or why it is looking for that file in a place where it does not exist.

(In reply to comment #3)
> Are you using the Eclipse SDK without any additional plugins? I'm not sure why
> it would be looking for intro\webresources\intro.xml or why it is looking for
> that file in a place where it does not exist.
> 

you are right, with Eclipse SDK only it doesn't write it to log.
